title.narrative: Envelop1 - Continue provision of Integrated Education and Protection Services to Children at Schools and IDPs at Camps in Dana and Maaret Tamisrin

description.narrative:
This project aims to continue providing integrated education ampprotection services to school children ampIDPs to better meet their diverse needs amppriorities, improve safety, equitable access, capacity, quality of education ampprotection services ampenhance the psychosocial wellbeing of children amp adults including people with special needs. ATAA will continue the support for 20 schools in 20 camps in Maaret Tamsrin amp Dana Sub-districts prioritized biased on allocation paper. Education: The project will implement comprehensive ampinclusive educational and recreational activities targeting 10563 children (B 5289, G 5274, 400 CwDs) with Formal amp Non formal education (summer program) (starting from 1st to 12th grades targeting all educational levels primary, middle amp secondary education. The project will include various activities as the following: ATAA is aiming to target children who are at risk of dropping out with summer program (Catch up/Remedial) to decrease drop out rate within FE. The children will be enrolled in FE amp provided with necessary supplies such as school bags/stationery Light rehabilitation will be provided to schools amp their WASH facilities such as repairing damaged doors, windows, etc to achieve safe, equitable amp protective education environment for children. The targeted schools have been rehabilitated through the previous project cost-efficient. Education facilities will be provided with the monthly running cost needed: safe drinking water, internet fees, stationery, cleaning materials, printing costs, etc Support education personnel with monthly incentives amp teaching materials. Children will be provided with SEL sessions to establish great learning environments amp exchange experiences among children. Capacity development for education personnel will be conducted on important topics for 4 days TICC/Distance Education/SEL/Safe learning. Base amp end-line ASER as well as mid amp final exams will be conducted to measure students’ progress amp achievement 2 rounds will be conducted in target camps to raise awareness on the importance of education amp increase enrollment in schools ATAA will support CwDs with Cash for education in FE to support their school attendance amp accessibility in the project locations due to economic barriers, ATAA will provide conditional cash for education to the CwDs(50$ per child per semester who are committed to a 70% attendance rate) Establishing amp activating (PTAs) amp (TLCs) in each school to engage parents/teachers/communities amp to be involved in the education process.
In line with education intervention amp allocation paper, ATAA will provide CP, and Protection intervention targeting children at ATAA schools/camps, in addition to IDPs in targeted camps to provide integrated protection services with high focus on PWDs with specialized service provision to a total BNFs of (2180 men, 2235 women, 3740 boys, 3790 girls)
Activities will be implemented in 2 rented amp equipped protection centers amp through 4 mobile protection disks to reach the most vulnerable people as follow: CP: CP awareness raising sessions Specialized case management service with ECF provision Structured PSS program targeting children (6-13) at schools Structured life skills program targeting adolescent students (14-17) in secondary schools. Structured parenting skills program targeting men amp women at camps Child Protection situation monitoring surveys provide training for education personnel on CPiE, PFA, CSG, SIR, PSEA support child protection committees previously established in project locations conduct CSG check visits to project schools on monthly basis Protection: Support 5 established amp trained mobile protection desks targeting 5 main camps clusters in the project location Provision of IPA service targeting vulnerable elderlies, PWDs, amp people with chronic disease Provision of AR sessions about protection risks in camps Conducting PM surveys in target locations
